id.title: Connection ID
id.description: The self assigned unique identifier of the connection

connectionType.title: Connection type
connectionType.description: The type determining the connection's underlying transport protocol

connectionStatus.title: Connection status
connectionStatus.description: The persisted/desired status of the connection

uri.title: Connection URI
uri.description: The URI defining the connections remote endpoint

ca.title: Trusted certificates
ca.description: Certificates to trust as DER in PEM-format

oneOf.title: Client certificate
oneOf.description: Client certificate with which Ditto authenticates itself at the connection URI

cert.title: Client certificate for type client-cert
cert.description: Client certificate for type client-cert as DER in PEM-format

key.title: Client private key for type client-cert
key.description: Unencrypted client private for type client-cert as PKCS8 in PEM-format

oneOf.title: AWS
oneOf.description: HMAC credentials with which Ditto authenticates itself at an AWS endpoint over HTTP

algorithm.title: Algorithm
algorithm.description: Name of the HMAC signing algorithm

service.title: Service
service.description: Service name of the AWS endpoint

accessKey.title: Access key
accessKey.description: Access key of the signing user

secretKey.title: Secret key
secretKey.description: Secret key of the signing user

doubleEncode.title: Double encode
doubleEncode.description: Whether to double-encode and normalize path segments during request signing. Should be `false` for S3 and `true` for other services.

canonicalHeaders.title: Canonical headers
canonicalHeaders.description: Array of names of headers to include in the signature. Default to `["host"]`

xAmzContentSha256.title: X-AMZ-CONTENT-SHA256
xAmzContentSha256.description: Configuration for the header `x-amz-content-sha256`, which is mandatory for S3. `EXCLUDED`: do not send the header for non-S3 services. `INCLUDED`: sign the payload hash as the value of the header for S3. `UNSIGNED`: omit the payload hash in the signature for S3.

oneOf.title: Azure Monitor
oneOf.description: HMAC credentials with which Ditto authenticates itself at Azure Monitor Data Collector over HTTP

algorithm.title: Algorithm
algorithm.description: Name of the HMAC signing algorithm

workspaceId.title: Workspace ID
workspaceId.description: ID of the Azure Monitor workspace

sharedKey.title: Shared key
sharedKey.description: Primary or secondary key of the Azure Monitor workspace

oneOf.title: Azure SASL
oneOf.description: HMAC credentials with which Ditto authenticates itself at Azure IoT Hub over HTTP/AMQP and Azure Service Bus over HTTP

algorithm.title: Algorithm
algorithm.description: Name of the HMAC signing algorithm

sharedKey.title: Shared key
sharedKey.description: Primary or secondary key of the Azure IoT Hub or Azure Service Bus instance. The key for Azure Service Bus needs an additional Base64 encoding to work (e.g. a primary key 'theKey' should be encoded to 'dGhlS2V5' and used in this format)

endpoint.title: Endpoint
endpoint.description: The endpoint which is used in the signature. For Azure IoT Hub this is expected to be the resourceUri without protocol (e.g. myHub.azure-devices.net). For Azure Service Bus, this is expected to be the full URI of the resource to which access is claimed (e.g. https://myNamespace.servicebus.windows.net/myQueue).

ttl.title: TTL
ttl.description: The time to live of a signature as a string in duration format. Allowed time units are “ms” (milliseconds), “s” (seconds), “m” (minutes) and “h” (hours), e.g. “10m” for ten minutes. ttl should only be set for AMQP connections and defines how long the connection signing is valid. The broker (e.g. Azure IoT Hub) will close the connection after ttl and Ditto will reconnect with a new signature. Defaults to 7 days.

oneOf.title: OAuth2 client credentials
oneOf.description: Credentials for OAuth2 client credentials flow over HTTP

clientId.title: Client ID
clientId.description: Client ID to include in access token requests

clientSecret.title: Client secret
clientSecret.description: Client secret to include in access token requests

requestedScopes.title: Requested scopes
requestedScopes.description: Space-separated requested scopes to include in access token requests

sources.title: The subscription sources of this connection
sources.description: The subscription sources of this connection

items.title: Source
items.description: A subscription source subscribed by this connection

addresses.title: Array of source addresses
addresses.description: The source addresses this connection consumes messages from.

items.title: Source address
items.description: A source address to consume messages from.

consumerCount.title: Consumer count
consumerCount.description: The number of consumers that should be attached to each source address.

authorizationContext.title: The authorization context
authorizationContext.description: The authorization context defines all authorization subjects associated for this source.

items.title: Authorization Subject
items.description: An authorization subject associated with this source. You can either use a fixed subject or use a placeholder that resolves header values from incoming messages. For example to use the `device_id` header in the subject, you can specify the placeholder `{{ header:device_id }}` which is then replaced by Ditto when a message from this source is processed. By using a placeholder you can access any header value: `{{ header:<any-header-name> }}`.

enforcement.title: Enforcement configuration
enforcement.description: Configuration of enforcement for this source

input.title: Input value of enforcement
input.description: The input value of the enforcement that should identify the origin of the message (e.g. a device id). Placeholders can be used within this field depending on the connection type. E.g. for AMQP 1.0 connections you can use `{{ header:[any-header-name] }}` to resolve the value from a message header.

filters.title: Array of enforcement filters
filters.description: An array of filters. One of the defined filters must match the input value from the message otherwise the message is rejected.

items.title: Enforcement filter string
items.description: A filter that must match the input value for a message to be accepted. You can use the placeholders `{{ thing:id }}`, `{{ thing:name }}` or `{{ thing:namespace }}` in a filter.

acknowledgementRequests.title: Acknowledgement requests configuration
acknowledgementRequests.description: Contains requests to acknowledgements which must be fulfilled before a message consumed from this source is technically settled/ACKed at the e.g. message broker.

includes.title: Included acknowledgement requests
includes.description: Acknowledgement requests to be included for each message consumed by this source.

items.title: String representation of a single acknowledgement request

filter.title: Filter expression whether to include acknowledgements at all
filter.description: Optional filter to be applied to the requested acknowledgements - takes an `fn:filter()` function expression

declaredAcks.title: Declared acknowledgement labels
declaredAcks.description: Contains labels of acknowledgements this source is allowed to send. Must be globally unique.

payloadMapping.description: References the IDs of payload mappers defined in the payload mapping definitions that are applied to messages received via this source.

headerMapping.title: Header mapping configuration
headerMapping.description: Ditto protocol headers computed from external headers and certain properties of the Ditto protocol messages created by payload mapping.

^.+$.title: header value
^.+$.description: The key is the Ditto protocol header key to set, the value can make use of placeholders in order to access external header values via `{{ header:[any-header-name] }}`, the Thing ID via `{{ thing:id }}` or to access the Ditto protocol topic via `{{ topic:[topic-placeholder-attr] }}`.

replyTarget.title: Reply target configuration
replyTarget.description: Configuration for sending responses of incoming commands.

address.title: Reply target address
address.description:
The target address where responses of incoming commands from the parent source are published to. The following placeholders are allowed within the target address:
 * Thing ID: `{{ thing:id }}`
 * Thing Namespace: `{{ thing:namespace }}`
 * Thing Name: `{{ thing:name }}` (the part of the ID without the namespace)
 * Ditto protocol topic attribute: `{{ topic:[topic-placeholder-attr] }}`
 * Ditto protocol header value: `{{ header:[any-header-name] }}`

If placeholder resolution fails for a response, then the response is dropped.

headerMapping.title: Header mapping configuration
headerMapping.description: External headers computed from headers and other properties of Ditto protocol messages.

^.+$.title: header value
^.+$.description: The key is the external header key to set, the value can make use of placeholders in order to access Ditto protocol header values via `{{ header:[any-header-name] }}`, the Thing ID via `{{ thing:id }}` or to access the DittoProtocol topic via `{{ topic:[topic-placeholder-attr] }}`.

expectedResponseTypes.title: Expected response types
expectedResponseTypes.description: Contains a list of response types that should be published to the reply target.

targets.title: The publish targets of this connection
targets.description: The publish targets of this connection

items.title: Target
items.description: A publish target served by this connection

address.title: Target address
address.description:
The target address where events, commands and messages are published to. The following placeholders are allowed within the target address:
 * Thing ID: `{{ thing:id }}`
 * Thing Namespace: `{{ thing:namespace }}`
 * Thing Name: `{{ thing:name }}` (the part of the ID without the namespace)
 * Ditto protocol topic attribute: `{{ topic:[topic-placeholder-attr] }}`
 * Ditto protocol header value: `{{ header:[any-header-name] }}`

topics.title: Topics
topics.description: The topics to which this target is registered for.

items.title: Subscribed topics.
items.description:
Contains the type of messages that are delivered to this target. You can receive
 * Thing events: `_/_/things/twin/events` (notification about twin change) 
 * Live events: `_/_/things/live/events`
 * Live commands: `_/_/things/live/commands`
 * Live messages: `_/_/things/live/messages`

You can specify an additional namespace and/or event filter (URL encoded)

authorizationContext.title: The authorization context
authorizationContext.description: The authorization context defines all authorization subjects associated for this target.

items.title: Authorization Subject
items.description: An authorization subject associated with this target.

issuedAcknowledgementLabel.title: Issued acknowledgement label for this target
issuedAcknowledgementLabel.description: the optional label of an acknowledgement which should automatically be issued by this target based on the technical settlement/ACK the connection channel provides.

payloadMapping.description: References the IDs of payload mappers defined in the payload mapping definitions that are applied to messages received via this target.

headerMapping.title: Header mapping configuration
headerMapping.description: External headers computed from headers and other properties of Ditto protocol messages.

^.+$.title: header value
^.+$.description: The key is the external header key to set, the value can make use of placeholder in order to access Ditto protocol header values via `{{ header:[any-header-name] }}`, the Thing ID via `{{ thing:id }}` or to access the Ditto protocol topic via `{{ topic:[topic-placeholder-attr] }}`.

clientCount.title: Client count
clientCount.description: The client count defines how many clients are instantiated for this connection. Each client opens a separate 'physical' connection and thus raises the overall availability and throughput of the connection. Clients are always instantiated on separate AKKA cluster nodes while having only a single client per node. Therefore the max client count is limited by the number of cluster nodes.

failoverEnabled.title: Failover enabled
failoverEnabled.description: Defines if this connection uses automatic reconnect/recovery mechanisms when an active open connection fails

validateCertificates.title: Validate certificates
validateCertificates.description: Defines if SSL certificate validation is enabled for this connection

processorPoolSize.title: Processor pool size
processorPoolSize.description: The processor pool size determines how many mapping processors are instantiated per client, therefore the total amount of mapping processors depends on the configured client count. By increasing the processor count, you can scale the message throughput in mapping scenarios.

specificConfig.title: Specific config
specificConfig.description: Depending on the configured connection type, there might be protocol specific configuration options or tuning settings available. These can be configured in the specific config object. The specific config object is interpreted as a key value based map of setting properties.

mappingEngine.title: Mapping engine
mappingEngine.description: The Mapping engine defines which kind of mapping processor is instantiated for this connection. Currently you can choose between `Ditto`, `JavaScript`, `Normalized` and `ConnectionStatus`. The payload mapper documentation provides a detailed description of available mappers or how to bring your own mapper.

options.title: Options
options.description: The mapping options contain specific configuration settings for the selected mapping engine. The options object is interpreted as a key value based map of setting properties.

additionalProperties.description: The configuration of a local SSH port forwarding used to tunnel the connection to the actual endpoint.

enabled.title: Whether the tunnel is enabled.
enabled.description: This flag controls whether Ditto establishes an SSH tunnel before connecting to the actual endpoint.

uri.title: SSH host
uri.description: The URI of the SSH host.

credentials.title: Credentials
credentials.description: Credentials with which Ditto authenticates itself at the SSH host.

password.title: The password for authentication.
password.description: A valid password. Only required for type `plain`.

publicKey.title: Public key for credentials type `public-key`.
publicKey.description: Public key for type `public-key` in PEM-format.

privateKey.title: Private key for credentials type `public-key`.
privateKey.description: Unencrypted private key for type `public-key` as PKCS8 in PEM-format.

validateHost.title: Whether the SSH host is verified.
validateHost.description: This flag controls whether Ditto verifies the SSH host used for tunneling by checking the public key provided by the host against the given public key fingerprints.

knownHosts.title: A list of accepted fingerprints.
knownHosts.description: One of these fingerprints must match the fingerprint of the public key the SSH host provides.

items.title: Fingerprint
items.description: A public key fingerprint in the format the command line tool `ssh-keygen` produces, e.g. `MD5:e0:3a:34:1c:68:ed:c6:bc:7c:ca:a8:67:c7:45:2b:19`. The fingerprint is prefixed with the hash algorithm used to calculate the fingerprint. Supported algorithms are `MD5`, `SHA1`, `SHA224`, `SHA256`, `SHA384` and `SHA512`

_revision.description: _(read-only)_ The revision is a counter which is incremented on each modification of a connection.

_created.description: _(read-only)_ The created timestamp of the connection in ISO-8601 UTC format. The timestamp is set on creation of a connection.

_modified.description: _(read-only)_ The modified timestamp of the connection in ISO-8601 UTC format. The timestamp is set on each modification of a connection.
